intro: Hieracium wiesbaurianum subsp. poeciloprasum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions. Its subspecies status reflects subtle differences in morphology compared to other Hieracium species.
